did.abstract: The Howe, W. mss., 1938-1943, consists of correspondence between editor Will David Howe, 1873-1946, and Wendell Lewis Willkie, 1892-1944.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Will David Howe, 1873-1946, was a professor at Indiana University and later an editor at Charles Scribner's Sons.
Wendell Lewis Willkie, 1892-1944, was an American lawyer and corporate executive as well as the 1940 Republican nominee for President of the United States.

While Howe was professor of English at Indiana University, he had Willkie in his classes. They remained in touch over the years and Howe was an ardent supporter of Willkie's candidacy for the Republican nomination for President of the United States in 1940.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Howe, W. mss., 1938-1943, consists of correspondence between editor Will David Howe, 1873-1946, and Wendell Lewis Willkie, 1892-1944. The correspondence here relates chiefly to requests for Willkie appearances and social or thank-you notes. There are also copies of two letters from Howe to Edith Willkie, a carbon copy of Willkie's letter to Ernest Hemingway of January 8, 1941, thanking the author for an autographed copy of For Whom the Bell Tolls, and a typed transcript of Dr. Howe's introduction of Willkie before a radio audience, May 21, 1940.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchase: Rebecca and Lucia Howe. Silver Lake, NH. 1996

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Howe, W. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
